title.rendered: “IDF Thwarts Terrorism in Major Night Raid: 11 Suspects Arrested, Weapons Seized Across Judea and Samaria”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

IDF soldiers, Shin Bet and Border Police arrested 11 suspects overnight across Judea and Samaria, and in the Jordan Valley and Valleys Brigade; they began a brigade operation to thwart terrorism in Burqa in Samaria.

The forces arrested overnight 11 suspects across Judea and Samaria.

In an operation to thwart terrorism by the Samaria Brigade that began in the village of Burqa, the soldiers arrested two suspects, detected and destroyed explosives, and seized weapons. The soldiers continue to operate in the village area even now.

In a proactive operation in the Jenin refugee camp, the soldiers arrested a suspect, detected and seized explosives. In the village of Al Fawar in the Judea Brigade, weapons were seized and suspects were arrested.

In the village of Ibeidiya in Etzion, the soldiers seized terror funds. In the village of Abu Dis, they detected and destroyed a bomb. In Zaatara, over ten illegal vehicles and weapons were seized. In Ein Al Sultan in the valley, a “Carlo” type rifle was found.

The suspects who were arrested and the weapons that were seized were transferred for further handling by the security forces.

So far, since the beginning of the war, about 2,450 suspects have been arrested across the Judea, Samaria, Jordan Valley and Valleys Brigade, about 1,210 of them are affiliated with the Hamas terrorist organization.

Attached are pictures of the seized weapons: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC25122023.02145
